text: [Music]
welcome to the class on personal
genomics and your health this really is
the topic of personalized medicine and
really the goal of personalized medicine
is to customize health care so that we
can really treat the individual rather
than the masses who might have a
particular disease perhaps equally
importantly what this course is going to
do it's going to cover the role of gen
gencs and genomics in managing
personalized health and also in this
great shift where we're trying to shift
from treating disease uh after symptoms
have occurred to be able to ultimately
predict and prevent disease and really
that's one of the major goals of
precision and personalized medicine so
in this course we're going to learn
about lots of different aspects of
personalized medicine and genomic
medicine we're going to learn about
General methods for acquiring genetic
information for medical and Consumer
Testing we're going to learn about
pharmacogenomics and the role of
genetics and Drug response we're going
to learn about considerations for
interpreting genomes and genetic
variants which is still a very tricky
business we're also start to talk about
the technology and its accuracy and
where it currently stands we're going to
talk about the various challenges for
bringing genomics into the clinic it's
not a very trivial issue and finally
we're going to talk about the pros and
cons of clinical genetic testing and all
the different aspects of medicine so
this is where we're going it's going to
be exciting class I think you're going
to learn a lot and will tell you what we
know about this area and ideally where
some of the future is in the space as
